text: Shiite militia and Iraqi government
forces are now moving ever closer to the
city of Fallujah itself having fought
their way through the surrounding
countryside
over the past week there's been fierce
fighting this morning in a key southern
suburb and government troops claim they
may enter the city itself later today
Fallujah lies less than 50 miles from
the capital Baghdad an Islamic States
been in control of it for the past two
years retaking the city is a key goal
for the government but as the final
assault on Fallujah draws closer concern
about the fate of the civilian
population is intensifying these
refugees are amongst the lucky ones they
managed to get out of the city in time
um Salaam says there's no food or
medicine in the city and says Islamic
state militants had taken their men away
she doesn't know if they're alive or
dead so far just four thousand civilians
have managed to escape Fallujah leaving
more than 40,000 still trapped inside
the city aid officials have been told
there's now panic and terror there many
of them have recounted seeing people
killed some have been buried alive or
killed during shelling and as their
houses have been destroyed others have
been killed stepping on IEDs or executed
by ISIL there are also stories of
families committing suicide or even
drowning their children in the river
again because they're so desperate and
it seems it's getting increasingly
difficult for civilians to get out of
Fallujah and that means any assault on
the heart of the city could leave many
dead we took out pin BBC News
